page.title: 20The Village Carnival
page.content: The first Barnburgh and Harlington Village Carnival was held in 1971 to start the raising of funds for the building of the Village Hall. The hall was eventually built in 1975 and the Carnival has continued annually .It is very much a village affair with all local organisations contributing in their own way, including the village school children for whom an art competition is held every year. Until 1981 the Carnival was held in Mr Durdy's field when inclement weather forced it up,to the Village Hall. This was so successful that ever since it has been held in the hall and the surrounding area. On Carnival Day traffic is diverted from the centre of the 'old' village which is full of stalls and the noisy activity of the villages at play.
